segment.source: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software
segment.target: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software

segment.source: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software
segment.target: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software

segment.source: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software
segment.target: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software

segment.source: This topic describes how to install the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 Server software by using the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard or by using command-line parameters.
segment.target: This topic describes how to install the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 Server software by using the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard or by using command-line parameters.

segment.source: Repeat the server installation process for each server on which you are configuring MBAM 2.5 Server features.
segment.target: Repeat the server installation process for each server on which you are configuring MBAM 2.5 Server features.

segment.source: After you finish the installation, see Configuring the MBAM 2.5 Server Features for steps about configuring the Server features.
segment.target: After you finish the installation, see Configuring the MBAM 2.5 Server Features for steps about configuring the Server features.

segment.source: Before you start
segment.target: Before you start

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Review the MBAM 2.5 planning information
segment.target: Review the MBAM 2.5 planning information

segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies

segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations

segment.target: High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5

segment.source: Read how to get log files
segment.target: Read how to get log files

segment.source: By default, log files are created in the local computer’s %temp% folder.
segment.target: By default, log files are created in the local computer’s %temp% folder.

segment.source: To write the log files to a specific location rather than to the %temp% folder, use the /loglocation argument.
segment.target: To write the log files to a specific location rather than to the %temp% folder, use the /loglocation argument.

segment.source: Additional events might be logged in Event Viewer in the MBAM-Setup or MBAM-Web nodes under Applications and Services Logs Microsoft Windows.
segment.target: Additional events might be logged in Event Viewer in the MBAM-Setup or MBAM-Web nodes under Applications and Services Logs Microsoft Windows.

segment.source: For example, if you uninstall MBAM, the uninstaller will also uninstall the MBAM-Setup and MBAM-Web logs in EventViewer.
segment.target: For example, if you uninstall MBAM, the uninstaller will also uninstall the MBAM-Setup and MBAM-Web logs in EventViewer.

segment.source: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server software by using the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard
segment.target: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server software by using the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard

segment.source: Use these steps to install the MBAM Server software by using the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.
segment.target: Use these steps to install the MBAM Server software by using the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.

segment.source: To install the MBAM 2.5 Server software by using the wizard
segment.target: To install the MBAM 2.5 Server software by using the wizard

segment.source: On the server where you want to install MBAM, run MBAMserversetup.exe to start the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.
segment.target: On the server where you want to install MBAM, run MBAMserversetup.exe to start the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.

segment.source: On the Welcome page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Welcome page, click Next.

segment.source: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Agreement, and then click Next to continue the installation.
segment.target: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Agreement, and then click Next to continue the installation.

segment.source: Choose whether to use Microsoft Update when you check for updates, and then click Next.
segment.target: Choose whether to use Microsoft Update when you check for updates, and then click Next.

segment.source: Choose whether to participate in the Customer Experience Improvement Program, and then click Next.
segment.target: Choose whether to participate in the Customer Experience Improvement Program, and then click Next.

segment.source: To start the installation, click Install.
segment.target: To start the installation, click Install.

segment.source: To configure the server features after the MBAM Server software finishes installing, select the Run MBAM Server Configuration after the wizard closes check box.
segment.target: To configure the server features after the MBAM Server software finishes installing, select the Run MBAM Server Configuration after the wizard closes check box.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can configure MBAM later by using the MBAM Server Configuration shortcut that the server installation creates on your Start menu.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can configure MBAM later by using the MBAM Server Configuration shortcut that the server installation creates on your Start menu.

segment.source: Click Finish.
segment.target: Click Finish.

segment.source: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server software by using a Command Prompt window
segment.target: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server software by using a Command Prompt window

segment.source: At a command prompt, type a command similar to the following command to install the MBAM Server software.
segment.target: At a command prompt, type a command similar to the following command to install the MBAM Server software.

segment.source: The following table describes the command-line parameters for installing the MBAM 2.5 Server software.
segment.target: The following table describes the command-line parameters for installing the MBAM 2.5 Server software.

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Parameter value
segment.target: Parameter value

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: CEIPENABLED
segment.target: CEIPENABLED

segment.source: True False
segment.target: True False

segment.source: True - participate in the Customer Improvement Experience Program, which helps Microsoft identify which MBAM features to improve.
segment.target: True - participate in the Customer Improvement Experience Program, which helps Microsoft identify which MBAM features to improve.

segment.source: False – do not participate in the Customer Improvement Experience Program.
segment.target: False – do not participate in the Customer Improvement Experience Program.

segment.source: OPTIN_FOR_MICROSOFT_UPDATES
segment.target: OPTIN_FOR_MICROSOFT_UPDATES

segment.source: True False
segment.target: True False

segment.source: True - use Microsoft Update to keep your computer secure and up-to-date for Windows and other Microsoft products, including MBAM.
segment.target: True - use Microsoft Update to keep your computer secure and up-to-date for Windows and other Microsoft products, including MBAM.

segment.source: False – do not use Microsoft Update
segment.target: False – do not use Microsoft Update

segment.source: INSTALLDIR
segment.target: INSTALLDIR

segment.source: Path
segment.target: Path

segment.source: Location where you want to install MBAM.
segment.target: Location where you want to install MBAM.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: INSTALLDIR=c:\mbaminstall
segment.target: INSTALLDIR=c:\mbaminstall

segment.source: FORCE_UNINSTALL
segment.target: FORCE_UNINSTALL

segment.source: True False
segment.target: True False

segment.source: True - continue the process of uninstalling MBAM, even if any features fail to be removed.
segment.target: True - continue the process of uninstalling MBAM, even if any features fail to be removed.

segment.source: False (default) if the uninstallation custom action fails to remove an added MBAM Server feature, the uninstallation fails, and MBAM remains installed.
segment.target: False (default) if the uninstallation custom action fails to remove an added MBAM Server feature, the uninstallation fails, and MBAM remains installed.

segment.source: In both instances, any features that were successfully removed during the attempt to uninstall MBAM stay removed.
segment.target: In both instances, any features that were successfully removed during the attempt to uninstall MBAM stay removed.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
